Ad Text:
Senior Data Solution Designer

Sydney


Contract

About the Role
We're working with a leading financial services client who are looking for an experienced Senior Data Solution Designer to help shape, develop, and deliver end-to-end data solutions aligned with enterprise architecture principles. This role plays a key part in ensuring that data initiatives meet business objectives and adhere to architectural and delivery standards.

The Opportunity
As a Senior Data Solution Designer, you will lead the architectural and solution design of data products across a growing cloud-based analytics platform. You will be instrumental in transforming legacy data systems into modern, scalable cloud solutions, ensuring consistent standards across data models, pipelines, and ingestion frameworks.

You'll be part of a central data team focused on delivering foundational data capabilities through a unified data model. Collaborating closely with engineering squads, architects, and platform teams, you will guide the delivery of robust, scalable, and efficient data products.

Key Responsibilities:

Contribute to strategic planning and help evolve data architecture frameworks.

Lead solution design across core data assets including ingestion pipelines, transformation frameworks, and data modeling.

Ensure alignment with enterprise architecture and collaborate on platform changes to support both functional and non-functional requirements.

Develop and maintain data design standards, ensuring consistent and high-quality delivery across all business units.

Provide technical oversight and guidance across various business domains such as Claims and Underwriting.

Act as a key liaison with data platform teams to advise on technical enhancements and platform upgrades.

Support continuous improvement of data delivery practices and platform capabilities.

What You'll Bring:

6-8+ years of experience in designing and delivering complex data solutions in enterprise environments.

Deep expertise in data architecture and modeling for data warehouse and data lake platforms.

Hands-on experience designing ETL/ELT frameworks and modern data pipelines, including real-time and batch processing.

Proven experience designing data solutions for advanced analytics, including AI/ML and digital applications.

Solid understanding of cloud data platforms, preferably with experience in Azure and Databricks.

Strong knowledge of modern data architecture and delivery methodologies, including CI/CD practices.

Skilled in leading technical delivery within Agile environments.

Experience guiding migrations from legacy systems to cloud-native data platforms.

Proficient in tools such as SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI, and related Microsoft technologies.

Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence stakeholders and lead technical teams.

Strong grasp of data governance, quality frameworks, and end-to-end data lifecycle management.

If interested, get in touch -

XO Sportsâ€¯is building a next-gen B2C mobile platform for the online sports market, starting with theâ€¯NBAâ€¯and expanding intoâ€¯AFL, NRL, and NFLâ€¯over the next 12 months.

Our platform is powered byâ€¯Azure cloud, leveraging a broad range of data services including Data Factory, Databricks, ADLS Gen2 and GitHub to enabling us to ingest, transform data model for ML training.Â  These insights can then be published real-time insightsâ€¯to fans and punters.

We're looking for an Azure Infrastructure Engineer who thrives in fast-paced environments and is passionate about building scalable, secure, and high-performance cloud solutions that support our mission to revolutionize the sports experience.

As part of our technology team, youâ€™ll lead automation efforts, champion infrastructure-as-code practices, and help shape the backbone of our digital platformsâ€”from internal systems to fan-facing applications. This is a hands-on role with strategic impact across our cloud operations, DevOps pipelines, and AI-driven services.

What Youâ€™ll Do

Azure governance ensuring policy design, tagging, cost optimization, and compliance.

Implement and manage Azure Policy and management group hierarchies across our enterprise subscriptions.

Build automated, AI-enhanced provisioning workflows using Azure Automation to support rapid deployment of sports data services and internal tools.

Develop infrastructure-as-code using PowerShell and Terraform to ensure repeatable, secure deployments.

Design and maintain CI/CD pipelines for infrastructure using GitHub Actions.

Collaborate with the technology team to align with Microsoftâ€™s Well-Architected Framework and XO Sportsâ€™ performance standards.

Support BAU cloud operations, including monitoring, patching, backups and lifecycle management of environments that power our data and analytics, mobile, and engagement platforms.

Apply systems administration expertise across Azure, Active Directory and Firebase to troubleshoot and support cloud-hosted workloads.

Continuously improve automation patterns and internal tooling to boost agility and reduce operational overhead.

Document processes and share knowledge across engineering teams to foster a culture of transparency and learning.

What You Bring

Proven experience with Azure Policy, management groups, and enterprise governance (Blueprints a plus).

Deep understanding of the Microsoft Well-Architected Framework and how to apply it in high-performance environments.

Experience building Azure landing zones and self-service automation templates.

Proficiency in PowerShell and Terraform.

Strong grasp of core Azure servicesâ€”compute, networking, identity, storage, monitoring, and security.

Exposure to AI-driven automation in Azure (OpenAI).

Experience with CI/CD tools like GitHub Actions.

A problem-solving mindset, attention to detail, and a collaborative spirit.

IVR Developer

Overview

FinXL IT Professional Services is a leading IT solutions organisation providing a broad range of services to assist large Australian enterprises and Government departments to deliver IT projects.

We're seeking an IVR Developer - Conversational AI Specialist (Contract) to join our consulting team and be deployed with a leading Telco client on a key transformation engagement.

Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy robust IVR systems with intuitive, human-centered Voice User Interface (VUI) capabilities.
Implement solutions for Voice Biometrics and build intent tags to ensure accurate, customer-driven interactions.
Implement end-to-end call flows, including deep API integration and robust reporting principles.
Produce technical design documentation and contribute to the execution of test cases for IVR development.

Key Skills & Experience

Strong understanding and proven experience in NLU interaction design and implementation.
Experience in Voice Biometrics application design and implementation.
Proficiency in IVR development and Customer Experience (CX) methodologies.
Experience with Text-to-Speech (TTS) and IVR application testing.
Detailed knowledge of the full software engineering life cycle (planning, scoping, development, and handover).
Ability to communicate effectively with both business stakeholders and engineering teams.
Familiarity with major Contact Centre environments (e.g., Genesys, Cisco, Nuance, NICE).

**Must be an Australian Citizen**

This role offers flexible location options in Melbourne, SA, and WA.

Apply Now! (M12)

Hey there! Thanks for stopping by. Weâ€™re Airtasker, the tech company that connects people who need to get things done with those who have the skills to do it.

Our mission is to empower people to realise the full value of their skills. This doesnâ€™t just apply to those who use our product. Itâ€™s also for our whooooooole team of go-getters who bring the product to life and deliver impact to our community on a daily basis. Because we believe work (and life) is always better when you truly know and appreciate your strengths and skills.

We are looking for an Analytics Engineer to join our growing Data Platform team. In this role, you will be at the heart of our data ecosystem, helping to build, maintain, and scale the infrastructure that empowers our entire organisation.

Your mission will be to develop the robust infrastructure, tooling, and data models that enable data analysts, data scientists, and machine learning engineers to work efficiently and effectively. You will be instrumental in shaping a reliable and scalable data foundation, making a significant impact on how data is used across the company.

This is an ideal position for someone with foundational data skills who is eager to grow their experience in cloud infrastructure, MLOps, and modern data and analytics engineering practices.

What you'll do:


Build & Maintain Data Pipelines: Design, develop, and maintain clean, performant, and reliable data models and transformation pipelines using dbt and SQL.

Develop Data Infrastructure: Contribute to the design, deployment, and management of our cloud data infrastructure on AWS using tools like Terraform.

Enable Self-Service Analytics: Build and support tooling and foundational datasets that empower stakeholders to answer their own questions and gain insights independently.

Champion Best Practices: Promote and apply software engineering best practices to our data domain, including version control (Git), CI/CD, testing, and documentation.

Collaborate & Educate: Work closely with data analysts, scientists, and other engineers to understand their needs, provide support, and share your knowledge of our data platform.

Support MLOps Initiatives: Assist in building out our MLOps capabilities, including supporting the deployment and operationalisation of models in AWS SageMaker.

Automate & Innovate: Use Python to develop tooling and automate processes to improve the efficiency and reliability of our data platform.

We'd love to hear from you if you tick some of these boxes:


A foundational understanding of the data lifecycle, from ingestion to analysis.

Proficiency in SQL for data modeling, transformation, and analysis.

Hands-on experience with dbt in a professional or personal project setting.

Familiarity with software engineering principles like version control, testing, and CI/CD.

A keen interest in learning about cloud platforms (we use AWS) and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform).

Some experience with Python for scripting or data manipulation is a big plus.

Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work through ambiguity.

A collaborative spirit, a growth mindset, and a genuine passion for data.

Bonus points:


Experience with a modern cloud data warehouse like Snowflake.

Exposure to AWS data services (e.g., S3, Glue, Lambda).

Familiarity with MLOps concepts or tools like SageMaker.

Our People Experience:


Our people team at Airtasker are dedicated to designing an industry leading people experience. This means creating an environment where you are empowered to do your best work and realise the full potential of your skills.

Thriving

Hybrid working - when it comes to working, thereâ€™s no â€œone size fits allâ€ approach, with Airtasker you choose the environment that helps you do your best work.

Airtime - welcome to no Slack and meeting-free Fridays! Airtime is designed so we regularly have dedicated focus time for work and personal growth.

Recharge days - each quarter we have a company-wide Recharge Day, equivalent to 4 additional days of leave per year. Itâ€™s a day for everyone when the world can wait and self-care takes centre stage.

Wellbeing support - our Employee Assistance Program provides confidential access for our people to GPs, dieticians, counselling and mental health specialists, providing essential support whenever needed.

Airpowerment Fund - we provide a $200 allowance to spend on anything that supports your health & wellbeing.


Rewarding

Airtasker credits - itâ€™s a great feeling to get things done. Even greater when you get $1000 worth of credits every year to help you check off your to-do list and connect with our community of Taskers.

Fair and equitable pay - this is a core commitment to our people. Every year we review industry data to ensure our compensation framework supports everyone to be recognised for the full value of their skills.

Tenure leave - To celebrate our peopleâ€™s commitment to Airtasker, we offer tenure leave starting from your 3rd anniversary with the company. This begins with 3 extra days of leave per year, gradually increasing to a maximum of 5 days per year.


Belonging

DAREtasker - join our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion committee! Every month we meet to create meaningful and impactful programs of work that embrace belonging at Airtasker.

Celebration swap - not everyone celebrates the same things. Thatâ€™s why, at Airtasker, you can swap national, state or territory public holidays for the ones that matter to you.


Growing

Learning and development - learning at Airtasker is on the job, guided by managers, enhanced by peers and led by ourselves. We deliver learning programs and budget allowances to invest in your growth.

360 performance reviews - feedback is a gift. Every year we run 360 reviews across the business to recognise achievements and promote personal growth.

Volunteer leave - Our team members can take a day each year to lend a helping hand and support a cause they are passionate about.


Celebrating

Awards - and the winners areâ€¦ our go-getters! Whether itâ€™s our peer-nominated quarterly Values Awards or our periodic Go-Getter Spirit Award, we love celebrating our people and spreading good energy.

Vibe committee - good vibes only! Our Vibe Committee delivers events that hit the sweet spot of bringing us all together to enjoy each otherâ€™s company whether youâ€™re local or remote.

Birthday leave - All of our people get an extra day of leave during their birthday week to take time away from work to celebrate.


At Airtasker we believe in culture add - that each person is different and has their own background, learnings and unique experiences that can add to the Airtasker cultural tapestry. We pride ourselves on our inclusive culture, and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds.

To all recruitment agencies and talent suppliers: Airtasker does not accept unsolicited resumes. Airtasker is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job postings or directly to our managers. If you are on our supplier list and have terms in place, ensure you work alongside our internal TA team and do not send resumes directly to managers.

dnata, one of the world's largest air services providers, offering a wide range of ground handling, cargo, travel and flight catering services across five continents is excited to announce a new opportunity within our IT team.

This exciting, newly created role offers a unique opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and contribute to data-driven decisions within dnataâ€™s diverse operations.

Experience working with data warehouses and data lakes

Experience with DevOps and working in AGILE teams

Experience working in global organisations with cross-functional local and regional teams

Staff / Lead Platform Engineer (ML & AI)

Have ML Engineering Skills

Tech Skills & Experience



We use a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. We don't expect you to know them all but experience or exposure with some of these (or equivalents) will set you up for success in this team;


Strong coding skills in Python, Go, or similar languages

Working with us

Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career with CommBank is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations.

About the business:

Progress Rail Australia, a Caterpillar company, is one of the largest integrated and diversified suppliers of railroad and transit system products and services worldwide. Product technology, reliability and durability, along with legendary aftermarket parts and service support, have been our keys to success.

Progress Rail is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. We value and embrace diversity of thought, background and unique experiences and we pride ourselves on an inclusive workforce and culture.




About the role:

The Locomotive Monitoring Center (LMC) Engineer is tasked with remotely monitoring and diagnosing locomotive issues using a variety of diagnostic and real-time monitoring tools. This role involves developing and providing recommended troubleshooting and repair work scopes.


Job tasks and responsibilities:

Works with various rail line services â€“ both domestic and international â€“ to remotely diagnose and troubleshoot locomotive issues

Remotely monitor locomotive fault codes and provide remote assistance with diagnosis and troubleshooting of mechanical and electrical systems of locomotives.

Job Description: Systems Engineer
Company: Crossmuller
Location: Glendenning, Sydney, NSW
Department: Systems Integration

Â 

About Us:
Crossmuller Systems Integration is a multi-disciplined engineering leader specialising in the design, build, and integration of advanced industrial systems across various customers and industries. Our project-based work spans diverse sectors including Food and Beverage, Data Centres, Manufacturing, Recycling, and Warehouse Automation.

Â 

The Role:
We are seeking an experienced and motivated Systems Engineer to play a key role in the delivery of our projects. You will be responsible for the technical design, implementation, and commissioning of complex integration solutions. Your ability to understand the big picture while managing the technical details will be key to successfully interfacing with both our internal teams and our clients.

This role is ideal for a competent technical professional who excels in a project environment and is looking to grow their career, with a clear path towards technical leadership and mentorship opportunities.




Key Responsibilities:

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Design, develop, and deploy integrated control systems, including PLC, SCADA, HMI, and industrial networking.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Architect and implement system solutions that meet client requirements, often involving integration with existing MES, ERP, and database applications.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Manage the technical aspects of projects, including system architecture design, specification writing, and code development.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Participation in commissioning activities, system troubleshooting, and providing client training.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Act as a technical point of contact for clients and collaborate effectively with other engineering departments to ensure seamless project execution.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Provide guidance and share knowledge with graduate engineers, contributing to the team's collective expertise.

Â 

About You:

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  You are an experienced engineer with a proven track record in systems integration within industrial environments.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  You thrive in a project-based role where no two days are the same, and you enjoy the challenge of adapting to different technical requirements and scopes.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  You are a confident problem-solver who can work autonomously to lead commissioning activities and interact directly with clients.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  You have a strong understanding of how different systems (electrical, mechanical, IT) interact and are skilled at making them work together.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  You possess strong communication and collaboration skills, and the ability to guide others is looked upon favourably as a key to future growth within our team.

Â 

Career Growth:
At Crossmuller, we are committed to the professional development of our staff. For the right candidate, this role offers a clear pathway for advancement. We value and will support your growth into technical leadership and mentorship positions, where you can take on greater responsibility for project deliverables and guide the next generation of engineers.

Â 

Essential Skills and Experience:

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  3+ years of experience in a similar systems integration, automation, or controls role.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Proven proficiency with industrial control platforms (e.g., Siemens TIA Portal, Rockwell Studio 5000/ControlLogix, Schneider EcoStruxure).

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Strong experience with SCADA/HMI systems (e.g., Inductive Automation Ignition, Aveva System Platform, Aveva Citect/Plant SCADA, Siemens WinCC, Rockwell FactoryTalk View).

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Solid understanding of industrial networking (switches, routers, VLANs, firewall configurations) and communication protocols (Modbus. BACnet, OPC UA, MQTT).

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Experience in database integration (SQL) and higher-level programming languages (e.g., C#, Python) is highly regarded.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to produce clear technical documentation.

Eligibility Requirements:

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  A degree in Software, Mechatronic, Electrical, or a related engineering field.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Available to work full-time and willing to travel to client sites for commissioning as required.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Possess a valid driver's licence.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency.

Job Description: Graduate Systems Engineer

Company: Crossmuller

Location: Glendenning, Sydney, NSW
Department: Systems Integration




About Us:
Crossmuller Systems Integration is a multi-disciplined engineering leader specialising in the design, build, and integration of advanced industrial systems across various customers and industries. Our project-based work spans diverse sectors including Food and Beverage, Data Centres, Manufacturing, Recycling, and Warehouse Automation.




The Role:

As a Graduate Systems Integrator, you will be immersed in the full project lifecycle of cutting-edge industrial systems. You will work alongside our senior engineers to design, develop, test, and commission integrated control solutions that form the backbone of modern industrial facilities. This role is designed to build your technical foundation and develop you into a well-rounded Systems Integration professional.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a passionate graduate to launch their career within a dedicated Systems Integration team, working on a variety of challenging projects from day one.




Key Responsibilities:

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Assist in the design and development of industrial control systems using PLCs, SCADA, HMI, and MES platforms.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Support the configuration of network infrastructure for industrial applications (Ethernet/IP, Profinet, MODBUS, BACNET etc.)

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Participate in software testing at our headquarters, and on-site commissioning at client facilities.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Collaborate with Project and Technical leads to deliver solutions.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Contribute to project documentation, including functional design specifications, test plans, and user manuals.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Gain exposure to a wide range of technologies, including industrial communication protocols, PLC languages, SCADA, MES, and Database systems.

About You:

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  You are a recent graduate (or in your final year) of a degree in Software, Mechatronic, Electrical, or Computer Systems Engineering.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  You have a fundamental understanding of software development and control system concepts.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  You are curious, proactive, and have a strong desire to learn new technologies and solve complex problems.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Strong attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Excellent time management and the ability to prioritise tasks effectively.




Eligibility Requirements:

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Available to work full-time.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Possess a valid driver's licence.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency (including New Zealand citizens).
